oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Vote for Democratic Nominees
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Large campaign poster urging the public to vote for the Democratic nominees: Cordell Hull, Henry Hollis Horton, William Emerson Brock and H. H. Hannah. There is a picture of each candidate on the poster. The election is to be held on November 4, 1930.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Posters; Political posters; Political elections; Political campaigns
Broadsides; Hull, Cordell, 1871-1955
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cordell Hull (1871-1955), elected U.S. Senator in 1930, served until resigning to become U.S. Secretary of State in 1933. Henry Hollis Horton served as Governor of Tennessee from 1927 to 1933. William Emerson Brock served as U.S. Senator from 1929 to 1931. H. H. Hannah had previously served as Adjutant General of Tennessee, and was elected as Railroad and Public Utilities Commissioner.
